oracle.spatial.rdf.client.jena

Class SemNetworkAnalyst

  • java.lang.Object
    • oracle.spatial.rdf.client.jena.SemNetworkAnalyst

  • public class SemNetworkAnalyst
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides key network analytical functions on top of semantic data.
    Since:
    Nov. 2011

        public org.apache.jena.rdf.model.Model buildSurroundingSubGraph(org.apache.jena.graph.Node[] nodeArray,
                                                                org.apache.jena.rdf.model.Model model,
                                                                java.io.Writer dotWriter)
                                                         throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                                                java.io.IOException
        Returns a surrounding sub graph in the form of a Jena Model for the path given.
        Parameters:
        nodeArray - an array of Jena Node denoting a path in a network. It MUST not be NULL.
        model - source Jena model.
        dotWriter - when provided (not null), a dot file will be generated and serialized to it. It can be NULL.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.io.IOException

      • buildSurroundingSubGraph

        public org.apache.jena.rdf.model.Model buildSurroundingSubGraph(org.apache.jena.graph.Node[] nodeArray,
                                                                org.apache.jena.rdf.model.Model model,
                                                                java.io.Writer dotWriter,
                                                                boolean skipDiagraph,
                                                                int limit,
                                                                DotStringProcessor dsp)
                                                         throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                                                java.io.IOException
        Returns a surrounding sub graph for the path given.
        Parameters:
        nodeArray - an array of Jena Node denoting a path in a network. It MUST not be NULL.
        model - source Jena model.
        dotWriter - when provided (not null), a dot file will be generated and serialized to it. It can be NULL.
        skipDiagraph - if true, skip writing the "digraph" header and corresponding footer to the provided writer
        limit - the maximum number of neighbors to be included for each node on the given path. It must be a positive integer.
        dsp - if set, will provide user defined processing for triple data. It can be NULL.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.io.IOException

      • createPowerlawPartition

        public void createPowerlawPartition()
                             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Partitions a logical power law network and creates a table to store information about the partitions. This method invokes the SDO_NET.LOGICAL_POWERLAW_PARTITION SQL API.

        This method uses default values to build the partitions. Use the getDefaultPowerlawPartitionTabName() method to retrieve the name of the powerlaw partition table created by this method.

        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        See Also:
        createPowerlawPartition(String,int,String,String,int,String)

      • createPowerlawPartition

        public void createPowerlawPartition(java.lang.String partitionTabName,
                                    int maxNumNodes,
                                    java.lang.String logLoc,
                                    java.lang.String logFile,
                                    int linkLevel,
                                    java.lang.String openMode)
                             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Partitions a logical power law network and creates a table to store information about the partitions. This method invokes the SDO_NET.LOGICAL_POWERLAW_PARTITION SQL API.

        The underlying SQL method can perform logging during the partitioning. To save the logging to a file, the logLoc and logFile arguments must not be null. The logLoc argument specifies the name of an Oracle SQL directory object. Use the create directory SQL command to create SQL directory objects, as shown below: 

        
     create or replace directory LOG_LOC_XYZ AS 'log_directory_here';
     grant all on directory LOG_LOC_XYZ to USER_ABC;

        The logFile parameter specifies the name of the log file to create in the directory described by the logLoc SQL directory object. The openMode parameter controls how the log file is opened or created. The openMode can take one of two values:

        • "W" - overwrite. Delete any existing log file with the same name and create a new file.
        • "A" - append. Append to the log file if the file already exists, otherwise create the file.
        Parameters:
        partitionTabName - name of the table to create to store information about the partitions
        maxNumNodes - maximum number of nodes to include in each partition
        logLoc - name of SQL directory object that identifies the directory for storing the log file
        logFile - name of the log file to create in the log directory
        linkLevel - network link level to use when partitioning, higher values indicate higher priority
        openMode - mode in which to open the log file, one of 'W' (write over) or 'A' (append)
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        See Also:
        createPowerlawPartition()

      • generateDOT

        public void generateDOT(java.io.Writer w,
                        java.util.List<org.apache.jena.graph.Triple> listHighlight,
                        java.util.List<org.apache.jena.graph.Triple> listBackground,
                        boolean skipDiagraph,
                        DotStringProcessor dsp)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        This method writes a DOT file to the given writer.
        Parameters:
        w - a Writer instance to serialize the DOT contents into.
        listHighlight - a list of Triple objects to highlight.
        listBackground - a list of background Triple objects.
        skipDiagraph - if true, skip writing the "digraph" header and corresponding footer to the provided writer
        dsp - if set, will provide user defined processing for triple data. It can be NULL.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getDefaultMaxNodes

        public int getDefaultMaxNodes()
        Returns the default value used for the max_num_nodes parameter when invoking the SDO_NET.LOGICAL_POWERLAW_PARTITION SQL API in createPowerlawPartition(). This value controls the maximum number of nodes to include in each powerlaw partition.
        Returns:
        default value used when setting the maximum number of nodes allowed per powerlaw partition

      • getInstance

        public static SemNetworkAnalyst getInstance(GraphOracleSem graph,
                                            boolean directed)
                                     throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                            oracle.spatial.network.lod.config.LODConfigException,
                                            oracle.spatial.network.lod.LODNetworkException
        Returns an instance of SemNetworkAnalyst using the specified graph as the data source for the network.
        Parameters:
        graph - semantic graph to use as the data source of a network
        directed - if true, then the predicate URIs in the graph will be treated as directed edges in the network, otherwise all predicate URIs will be treated as bidirectional.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        oracle.spatial.network.lod.config.LODConfigException
        oracle.spatial.network.lod.LODNetworkException

      • getInstance

        public static SemNetworkAnalyst getInstance(GraphOracleSem graph,
                                            boolean directed,
                                            boolean cleanup)
                                     throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                            oracle.spatial.network.lod.config.LODConfigException,
                                            oracle.spatial.network.lod.LODNetworkException
        Returns an instance of SemNetworkAnalyst using the specified graph as the data source of the network.
        Parameters:
        graph - semantic graph to use as the data source of a network
        directed - if true, then the predicate URIs in the graph will be treated as directed edges in the network, otherwise all predicate URIs will be treated as bidirectional.
        cleanup - if true, then metadata generated during a previous network creation will be dropped
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        oracle.spatial.network.lod.config.LODConfigException
        oracle.spatial.network.lod.LODNetworkException

      • getInstance

        public static SemNetworkAnalyst getInstance(GraphOracleSem graph,
                                            boolean directed,
                                            boolean cleanup,
                                            java.util.Map<org.apache.jena.graph.Node,java.lang.Double> costMapping)
                                     throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                            oracle.spatial.network.lod.config.LODConfigException,
                                            oracle.spatial.network.lod.LODNetworkException
        Returns an instance of SemNetworkAnalyst using the specified graph as the data source of the network.
        Parameters:
        graph - semantic graph to use as the data source of a network
        directed - if true, then the predicate URIs in the graph will be treated as directed edges in the network, otherwise all predicate URIs will be treated as bidirectional.
        cleanup - if true, then metadata generated during a previous network creation will be dropped
        costMapping - mapping between predicate URIs to a numeric cost value (if null then the cost of all precidates will default to 1)
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        oracle.spatial.network.lod.config.LODConfigException
        oracle.spatial.network.lod.LODNetworkException

      • init

        public void init(java.util.Map<org.apache.jena.graph.Node,java.lang.Double> costMapping)
          throws java.sql.SQLException,
                 oracle.spatial.network.lod.config.LODConfigException,
                 oracle.spatial.network.lod.LODNetworkException
        Initializes all the metadata required for this SemNetworkAnalyst instance's operations. It is invoked automatically from the SemNetworkAnalyst constructor.
        Parameters:
        costMapping - mapping between predicate URIs to a numeric cost value (if null then the cost of all precidates will default to 1). Note that the mapping does not have to be complete. Unspecified predicates will have a cost default to 1.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        oracle.spatial.network.lod.config.LODConfigException
        oracle.spatial.network.lod.LODNetworkException

      • mapBackLinkIDs

        public long[] mapBackLinkIDs(long[] lMappedLinkIDs)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method maps back LINK IDs to the original RDF resource (predicate) IDs. The returned array will have the same size as the mapped LINK ID array and entries in the returned array correspond directly with entries in the mapped LINK ID array.
        Parameters:
        lMappedLinkIDs - an integer array of LINK IDs
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • mapBackNodeIDs

        public long[] mapBackNodeIDs(long[] lMappedNodeIDs)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Maps back an array of Node IDs to the original RDF resource IDs by querying the internal Node view (table). The returned array will have the same size as the mapped Node ID array and entries in the returned array correspond directly with entries in the mapped Node ID array.
        Parameters:
        lMappedNodeIDs - mapped Node IDs to map back to their corresponding original RDF resource IDs
        Returns:
        original RDF resource IDs for the given mapped values
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if there is any IDs that cannot be mapped.
        See Also:
        mapNodeIDs(long[])

      • mapNodeIDs

        public long[] mapNodeIDs(long[] lOrgNodeIDs)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Maps an array of original Node IDs (RDF resource IDs) to a sequence of integer values to be consumed by NDM functions. The returned array will have the same size as the Node ID array and entries in the returned array correspond directly with entries in the Node ID array.
        Parameters:
        lOrgNodeIDs - Node IDs to map to valid integer values
        Returns:
        sequence of valid integer values associated with the given Node IDs
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if there is any IDs that cannot be mapped.
        See Also:
        mapBackNodeIDs(long[])

                                                          oracle.spatial.network.lod.LODNetworkException

      • shortestPathAStar

        public org.apache.jena.graph.Node[] shortestPathAStar(org.apache.jena.graph.Node nodeStart,
                                                      org.apache.jena.graph.Node nodeEnd)
                                               throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                                      oracle.spatial.network.lod.LODNetworkException
        A Node array is returned to represent the shortest path. The first element in the array is the starting point, followed by a link (RDF predicate). This Node array ends with the destination point. Note that a dummy cost function is used for A* search. If there is no path, then a NULL value will be returned.
        Parameters:
        nodeStart - start node of the path
        nodeEnd - end node of the path
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        oracle.spatial.network.lod.LODNetworkException

      • shortestPathAStar

        public org.apache.jena.graph.Node[] shortestPathAStar(org.apache.jena.graph.Node nodeStart,
                                                      org.apache.jena.graph.Node nodeEnd,
                                                      oracle.spatial.network.lod.HeuristicCostFunction hcf)
                                               throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                                      oracle.spatial.network.lod.LODNetworkException
        A Node array is returned to represent the shortest path. The first element in the array is the starting point, followed by a link (RDF predicate). This Node array ends with the destination point. If there is no path, then a NULL value will be returned.
        Parameters:
        nodeStart - start node of the path
        nodeEnd - end node of the path
        hcf - a heuristic cost function
        Throws:

      • shortestPathDijkstra

        public org.apache.jena.graph.Node[] shortestPathDijkstra(org.apache.jena.graph.Node nodeStart,
                                                         org.apache.jena.graph.Node nodeEnd)
                                                  throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                                         oracle.spatial.network.lod.LODNetworkException
        Returns a shortest path between the two specified nodes using Dijkstra's shortest path algorithm. Each node in the returned array of nodes represents a node (or edge) along the shortest path. The first element in the array is the start node, followed by a link (RDF predicate). This Node array ends with the destination node. If there is no path, then a null value will be returned.
        Parameters:
        nodeStart - start node of the path
        nodeEnd - end node of the path
        Returns:
        shortest path between the starting and destination points
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        oracle.spatial.network.lod.LODNetworkException

      • shortestPathDijkstra

        public org.apache.jena.graph.Node[] shortestPathDijkstra(org.apache.jena.graph.Node nodeStart,
                                                         org.apache.jena.graph.Node nodeEnd,
                                                         long timeConstraint)
                                                  throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                                         oracle.spatial.network.lod.LODNetworkException
        Returns a shortest path between the two specified nodes using Dijkstra's shortest path algorithm. The first element in the array is the starting point, followed by a link (RDF predicate). This Node array ends with the destination point. If there is no path, then a NULL value will be returned.
        Parameters:
        nodeStart - start node of the path
        nodeEnd - end node of the path
        timeConstraint - run time constaint in ms. If zero or negative, then no time constraint is set.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        oracle.spatial.network.lod.LODNetworkException

      • withinCost

        public org.apache.jena.graph.Node[][] withinCost(org.apache.jena.graph.Node nodeStart,
                                                 double cost)
                                          throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                                 oracle.spatial.network.lod.LODNetworkException
        Finds the nodes within the specified cost from the start node. Both the search and the target link levels are set to the lowest link level (lowest priority).

        This method returns an array of paths, where each path is itself an array of nodes. For example, the following code snippet will print out all the paths found, 

        
     Node [][] paths = withinCost(...);
     for( int i = 0; i < paths.length; ++i ) {
         Node [] path = paths[i];
         System.out.printf( "Path %3d: ", i );
         for( int j = 0; j < path.length; ++j ) {
             System.out.printf( "(%s) ", path[j].toString() );
             if( j < (path.length - 1) ) {
               System.out.print( "-->" );
             }
         }
         System.out.println();
      }
        Parameters:
        nodeStart - start node from which to search
        cost - maximum cost (distance) from the starting point to search within
        Returns:
        array of paths to the target nodes (nodes within cost) from the starting node. Each path is represented using an array of Jena Node.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        oracle.spatial.network.lod.LODNetworkException
        See Also:
        NetworkAnalyst.withinCost(oracle.spatial.network.lod.PointOnNet, double, oracle.spatial.network.lod.LODNetworkConstraint, oracle.spatial.network.lod.LODGoalNode)

      • withinCost

        public org.apache.jena.graph.Node[][] withinCost(org.apache.jena.graph.Node nodeStart,
                                                 double cost,
                                                 long timeConstraint)
                                          throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                                 oracle.spatial.network.lod.LODNetworkException
        Finds the nodes within the specified cost from the start node and within the given time constraint. Both the search and the target link levels are set to the lowest link level (lowest priority).

        This method allows setting a time constraint in milliseconds to limit the amount of time spent searching for nodes. Note that this method will not throw an exception if the it reaches the time constraint; instead, this method will return the paths it was able to find within the time limit.

        This method returns an array of paths, where each path is itself an array of nodes. For example, the following code snippet will print out all the paths found, 

        
     Node [][] paths = withinCost(...);
     for( int i = 0; i < paths.length; ++i ) {
         Node [] path = paths[i];
         System.out.printf( "Path %3d: ", i );
         for( int j = 0; j < path.length; ++j ) {
             System.out.printf( "(%s) ", path[j].toString() );
             if( j < (path.length - 1) ) {
               System.out.print( "-->" );
             }
         }
         System.out.println();
      }
        Parameters:
        nodeStart - start node from which to search
        cost - maximum cost (distance) from the starting point to search within
        timeConstraint - maximum time in milliseconds to spend searching for nodes within cost
        Returns:
        array of paths to the target nodes (nodes within cost) from the starting node
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        oracle.spatial.network.lod.LODNetworkException
        See Also:
        NetworkAnalyst.withinCost(oracle.spatial.network.lod.PointOnNet, double, oracle.spatial.network.lod.LODNetworkConstraint, oracle.spatial.network.lod.LODGoalNode)
